column5: Whats a thunderbox?
Whats a thunderbox?  a crapper.

Maybe they were thinking of coming back after work and cleaning it up a little more.  You could be right. There was at least a few pounds worth of flowers left on the lower branches from the plants they chopped...  This is also the first time I've seen or heard of police burning plants at the grow site, but it was on the reserve so I'm guessing they likely do thing's a little different than the OPP.
I found a huge grow-op yesterday simply using Google Earth. It's called Jamaica.  I know of a bigger one... often referred to by the initials B.C.
Crazy the lengths people have to go to grow a natural plant for personal use so they don't get thrown in the slammer...
Thats a pot plant????  WOW!
Any frost yet up there?  That plant shoulda been processed by now...  Cool find though.  You'll have good karma if you let it be..  cheers HD

Any frost yet up there?  That plant shoulda been processed by now...  Cool find though.  You'll have good karma if you let it be..  cheers HD  yeah, there's been frost  you seem to know a little about this stuff, I guess that's why you're called "high" drifter, (just kidding)

It amazes me the lengths that someone would go to in order to get a few ounces of the sacramental herb for personal use. Some of you might be able to shed light on what I've been told by different members of our judicial system, both law enforcement as well as an Assistant Crown Attorney. If there is merit to this please chime in. I have been told that a citizen of Ontario is allowed to grow no more than 5 weed plants for personal use at any given time. They can not leave the property, can not be sold and must be only consumed indoors.  A neighbour in her late 60,s grows 5 in her garden every spring. Another lookie loo neighbour called it into the local OPP. They came out and told her basically good luck and basically what I wrote above.  This is not the US, no one is going to jail growing a few pot plants in their garden and keeping it at home, I wouldn't save it from year to year as it would be a bit tricky to explain why there is 10 pounds of the stuff in the fridge. I don't grow any for a few reasons. I only over eat and then fall asleep when I smoke it. My aches and pains pound harder after I smoked it and I'm too lazy. My wife partakes in the sacramental herb and she can do it next door.
yeah, there's been frost  you seem to know a little about this stuff, I guess that's why you're called "high" drifter, (just kidding) Naoh I dunno jack!!!
Should have checked the pot the plant was in for a name on it, like maybe Justin or Rob! HH

It amazes me the lengths that someone would go to in order to get a few ounces of the sacramental herb for personal use. Some of you might be able to shed light on what I've been told by different members of our judicial system, both law enforcement as well as an Assistant Crown Attorney. If there is merit to this please chime in. I have been told that a citizen of Ontario is allowed to grow no more than 5 weed plants for personal use at any given time. They can not leave the property, can not be sold and must be only consumed indoors.  A neighbour in her late 60,s grows 5 in her garden every spring. Another lookie loo neighbour called it into the local OPP. They came out and told her basically good luck and basically what I wrote above.  This is not the US, no one is going to jail growing a few pot plants in their garden and keeping it at home, I wouldn't save it from year to year as it would be a bit tricky to explain why there is 10 pounds of the stuff in the fridge. I don't grow any for a few reasons. I only over eat and then fall asleep when I smoke it. My aches and pains pound harder after I smoked it and I'm too lazy. My wife partakes in the sacramental herb and she can do it next door.  The Feds just changed the medical laws so that authorized medical users cannot grow their own on their own property, you now need to buy it from large-scale producers and get it delivered by courrier. And now they have to smoke it and cannot buy brownies or other means that are less harmful to lungs. Nice open market eh?  That's for medical laws, not sure about the personal side of things... I know its 'decriminalized' to some degree.

Harper made it law last summer  that 6 or more is an mandatory jail sentence.. I honestly don't believe anyone has served any time as of yet under this new law. I have a neighbor that has grown in his vegetable garden every year. Has never been caught and has never sold a crumb..Its all for him..The best part is he is still a elected city official... I only know because I have known him for 17 years and help him with his gardening.. Vegetables not pot....  But ya interesting subject to say the least..It should be legal for personal uses. I also have a feeling it wont be long before it is..With Justin and company pushing for it and the states that are legit we wont be far behind...
Harper made it law last summer  that 6 or more is an mandatory jail sentence..  Too bad they didn't worry more about stiffer sentences for REAL criminals.
It is a plant that distorts reality same as a bottle of beer in my eyes. If you want to grow it for your own use and do not involve any kind of criminal element have a great time. IMHO.   Art

Too bad they didn't worry more about stiffer sentences for REAL criminals. Right Lew. The Feds just want the taxes. No thought of real criminals who could care less about the law. Forcing Medical patients to buy or risk going to jail as most will not be able to afford buying from large scale businesses.
they never come back from       Copperhead Road..

Too bad they didn't worry more about stiffer sentences for REAL criminals.  Pretty much, the guy growing a few pot plants at home for his cancer is not someone the police should be wasting their time on.

Harper made it law last summer  that 6 or more is an mandatory jail sentence.  .It should be legal for personal uses. I also have a feeling it wont be long before it is..With Justin and company pushing for it and the states that are legit we wont be far behind...   After Justin Trudeau admitted to using marijuana  there was a surge in his political popularity. Then all these political folks all started admitting to using. Premiere Wynne, PC Tim Hudak, etc.... Of course mayor Rob Ford bragged he smoked a  lot  lol  Met someone  10 yrs. ago  who tried small outdoor grow-op around Bancroft and got caught. It kinda wrecked his life was my impression.   Interesting find in woods. A flowerpot of pot
After spending a trillion bucks or so of tax payers dollars ask how our war on drugs is doing. LOL   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fr3TkOGgeJY
Thats actually funny..Smiled and waved as we sat on our sack of seeds

guarantee the new legislation the pharma companies get on board soon. theres lots of money to be made. then doctors will prescribe on compassion grounds. guaranteed within 3 years. funny though pots been around since time started pharmaceutical companies not so.. as lew stated in a past post. theres bigger fish to fry.
i can't wait until i am free to cultivate cannabis in my own home.

Laws current until 2013-09-16, so currently no laws on growing or posession? Maybe someone can clarify this?  http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-38.8/page-25.html#docCont  Also found this in regards to Old Ironmakers Q on legality to grow x amounts...  http://www.canadianmedicinalmarijuana.com/?p=28

Each year I stumble upon at least a couple grow ops while out hunting, walking the dogs, or ATVing usually ranging from one to 10 plants. But, last year I got the jitters after finding a 1000+ plant grow op that was clearly run by professionals with multiple gas water pumps, tons of water lines, fertilizer bins tied to the water lines for easy fertilizing, and rows upon rows of plants about 4ft tall.  The cops found the grow and did a half ass job of destroying the weed, almost like they intentionally left product behind...
I found a huge grow-op yesterday simply using Google Earth. It's called Jamaica.

The cops found the grow and did a half ass job of destroying the weed, almost like they intentionally left product behind...  Maybe they were thinking of coming back after work and cleaning it up a little more.

The other day I was grouse hunting and saw a white bucket off the trail a little ways. As I was thinking about turning around and heading a different direction I realized it was part of a homemade thunder box… Same affect…. I headed another direction.
I was scoping out potential new duck hunting ponds, on my ATV, I walked off the beaten path for a while and came across this    I snooped around a little more, but it looked like a 1 pot operation
It looked like a 1 pot operation  rim shot
This Buds for you?
a new style buzz bait for bass fishing

Be careful if you come across a large grow op on crown land. There was a big bust in the Almaguin area recently and police had to make sure there were no officer safety issue before going in. I take that to mean booby traps etc..
I came across a few while walking near a road after fishing a stream, I just kept my head down and kept walking.
I came across a few while walking near a road after fishing a stream, I just kept my head down and kept walking. I've come across a couple over the years.I try and get away asap from that area.

I had my 12 gauge, but I sure didn't feel like having someone shooting back at me  I bet some guys would want these GPS cords more than those for a hot Haliburton bass lake

Tis the season to ber jolly
I'm pretty neutral about small time stuff, but small or big and I find garbage, your stuff is going to be reported.
The cartel is alive and well in Haliburton.
That is some dudes personal stuff. Judging by the size of the pot he is using, he is no pro..Edited to add that neither am i..lol I just work around a lot of greenhouses..
Needs some fertilizer
Looks like a little frost got to the top leaves     I have come across a few plants over the years looking for new fishing spots , I just keep walking .
That could be one of many.   It's how it's hidden from aerial views.   They could have 100's all around the area.
That's probably some guys personal stash, I wouldn't think twice about it.   And from the looks of that plant, he's not going to get a very good harvest from it anyhow, lol
Ahhhh the great outdoors.  She's got some half decent buds on 'er... but she's still only a one night party for a few.

LOL Terry, we still get the helicopters flying 4 to 6 abreast low over the fields and woods in my area searching for pot. I can't imagine why some people in the area seem very upset that the county sheriff has started using drones?  Then we also had a few homes in the area that were purchased and turned into green houses for indoor pot growing operations.

I hope they got more, there aint enough there to make it to christmas let alone next year

Just follow your nose....it always knows!   Weak effort, very weak.   lol.
Any ducks?? LOL  Smoke 'em if ya got 'em!  S.
